it.unibo.alchemist.core.implementations

Class Simulation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.alchemist.core.implementations.Simulation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISimulation<T>, Runnable

    public class Simulation<T>
extends Object
implements ISimulation<T>
    This class implements a simulation. It offers a wide number of static factories to ease the creation process.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(IEnvironment<T> e,
                  ITime t)
        Builds a simulation for a given environment. By default it uses a DependencyGraph and an IndexedPriorityQueue internally. If you want to use your own implementations of IDependencyGraph and IReactionManager interfaces, don't use this constructor.
        Parameters:
        e - the environment at the initial time
        t - the maximum time to reach

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(IEnvironment<T> e,
                  ITime t,
                  boolean multiThread)
        Builds a simulation for a given environment. By default it uses a DependencyGraph and an IndexedPriorityQueue internally. If you want to use your own implementations of IDependencyGraph and IReactionManager interfaces, don't use this constructor.
        Parameters:
        e - the environment at the initial time
        t - the maximum time to reach
        multiThread - if true, the simulation will try to parallelize the update phase

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(IEnvironment<T> e,
                  long maxSteps)
        Builds a simulation for a given environment. By default it uses a DependencyGraph and an IndexedPriorityQueue internally. If you want to use your own implementations of IDependencyGraph and IReactionManager interfaces, don't use this constructor.
        Parameters:
        e - the environment at the initial time
        maxSteps - the maximum number of steps to do

      • Simulation

        public Simulation(IEnvironment<T> e,
                  long maxSteps,
                  boolean multiThread)
        Builds a simulation for a given environment. By default it uses a DependencyGraph and an IndexedPriorityQueue internally. If you want to use your own implementations of IDependencyGraph and IReactionManager interfaces, don't use this constructor.
        Parameters:
        e - the environment at the initial time
        maxSteps - the maximum number of steps to do
        multiThread - if true, the simulation will try to parallelize the update phase

      • nodeAdded

        public static <T> void nodeAdded(IEnvironment<T> env,
                                 INode<T> node)
        This method provide a facility for adding all the reactions of a node to the current simulation, creating also the dependencies. This method must be called only when it is possible for the environment to successfully compute the neighborhood for the new node.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type for concentrations
        Parameters:
        env - the environment
        node - the freshly added node

      • nodeRemoved

        public static <T> void nodeRemoved(IEnvironment<T> env,
                                   INode<T> node,
                                   INeighborhood<T> oldNeighborhood)
        This method provide a facility for removing all the reactions of a node from the current simulation, along with their dependencies. This method must be called when it is still possible for the environment to successfully compute the neighborhood for the removed node.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type for concentrations
        Parameters:
        env - the environment
        node - the freshly removed node
        oldNeighborhood - the neighborhood of the node as it was before it was removed (used to calculate reverse dependencies)

                                      IReaction<T> r)
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        r - the removed reaction

        Returns:
        a reference to the current Environment. The environment is not a copy but back-ends the real environment used in the simulation. Manipulate it carefully

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        When called, the simulation finishes its execution cycle and then stops. It will be possible to edit the environment manually and to restart the execution by calling play().
        Specified by:
        pause in interface ISimulation<T>

      • pauseAndWait

        public void pauseAndWait()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        When called, the simulation finishes its execution cycle and then stops. It will be possible to edit the environment manually and to restart the execution by calling play(). The caller will be suspended until the simulation effectively restarted.
        Specified by:
        pauseAndWait in interface ISimulation<T>

      • play

        public void play()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        Tries to resume the simulation from stopped and paused Status. It's not guaranteed to work if status is stopped. Calling it when status is running should produce no effect at all.
        Specified by:
        play in interface ISimulation<T>

      • playAndWait

        public void playAndWait()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        Tries to resume the simulation from stopped and paused Status. It's not guaranteed to work if status is stopped. Calling it when status is running should produce no effect at all. The caller will be suspended until the simulation effectively paused.
        Specified by:
        playAndWait in interface ISimulation<T>

      • playSingleStep

        public void playSingleStep()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        Runs a single simulation step, then pauses the simulation. If the simulation is already running, it will be paused, but the number of steps run is not guaranteed to be one.
        Specified by:
        playSingleStep in interface ISimulation<T>

      • playSingleStepAndWait

        public void playSingleStepAndWait()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        Runs a single simulation step, then pauses the simulation and waits until it is effectively paused to return back the control. If the simulation is already running, it will be paused, but the number of steps run is not guaranteed to be one.
        Specified by:
        playSingleStepAndWait in interface ISimulation<T>

      • removeOutputMonitor

        public void removeOutputMonitor(OutputMonitor<T> op)
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        Removes an OutputMonitor to this simulation. If the OutputMonitor was not among those already added, this method does nothing.
        Specified by:
        removeOutputMonitor in interface ISimulation<T>
        Parameters:
        op - the OutputMonitor to add

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        When called, the simulation stops. It's not guaranteed that it could be resumed.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ISimulation<T>

      • stopAndWait

        public void stopAndWait()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulation
        When called, the simulation stops. It's not guaranteed that it could be resumed. The caller will be suspended until the simulation effectively stopped.
        Specified by:
        stopAndWait in interface ISimulation<T>
